job_details.Functieomschrijving:
You will work in a team of highly skilled engineers, to:
     * Achieve uptime >99.99%.
     * Manage and expand the physical servers, OS's and networks in multiple datacenters.
     * Manage and expand our AWS cloud environments in multiple regions.
     * Understand a complex technical architecture with a high degree of customisation.
     * Operate and improve our automation tooling.
     * Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation schedule.
     * Provide a flexible infrastructure to the rest of the company up to and including the base OS layer and kubernetes.
     * Work with a DevOps mindset with other teams within the company to bring our products to a large number of corporate customers worldwide.
job_details.full_text:
Linux/Infra System Engineer

You will work in a team of highly skilled engineers, to:
     * Achieve uptime >99.99%.
     * Manage and expand the physical servers, OS's and networks in multiple datacenters.
     * Manage and expand our AWS cloud environments in multiple regions.
     * Understand a complex technical architecture with a high degree of customisation.
     * Operate and improve our automation tooling.
     * Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation schedule.
     * Provide a flexible infrastructure to the rest of the company up to and including the base OS layer and kubernetes.
     * Work with a DevOps mindset with other teams within the company to bring our products to a large number of corporate customers worldwide.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on infrastructure, systems, and cloud management (Linux, AWS, Kubernetes, datacenters, uptime) and DevOps principles. It does not mention any specific AI models, generative techniques, LLM frameworks, or AI-specific modeling tasks. The role appears to be a traditional Infrastructure/DevOps Engineer, not directly involved in AI development or deployment.

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions 'Achieve uptime >99.99%', 'Manage and expand the physical servers, OS's and networks', 'Manage and expand our AWS cloud environments', 'Operate and improve our automation tooling', 'Provide a flexible infrastructure... up to and including the base OS layer and kubernetes', and 'Work with a DevOps mindset'. These all relate to the operational aspects of managing and maintaining infrastructure and systems, which falls under Operations Engineering.
Managing physical servers, OSs, and networks in datacenters is a core responsibility of infrastructure and operations engineering.
